Deficiency Narrative: Police responded to the incident; however, licensing was not notified.
Correction Narrative: The administrator reported that once the Child has been called into Fort Bend Police and an officer is dispatched to the home to initiate the report, and an Incident number is provided, staff on shift will immediately report the Incident number to the administrator and the administrative team to ensure licensing is notified within the minimum requirement of 24 hours. This will be done via email to ensure the communication is reported in a timely manner.	Administrator/ Administrative Team. As well as CEO

Deficiency Narrative: Operation staff left child at behavioral hospital without a bed available. Operation staff refused to sign for child at hospital once a bed became available stating they are not designated medical consenters. When operation was called to return for child they refused saying they had already submitted a 24-hour discharge for child and child was no longer their responsibility.
Correction Narrative:
Corrections submitted via email 5/26/25:
 Policies will be updated to read "Anytime a resident is taken to the hospital for any reason, the LCCA will make sure there is a staff member present with the resident until admission. In the event there is no bed available or there is a change to the admission plan, Unique Teen staff will remain with resident until they are either admitted or discharged back to Unique Teen or the residents caseworker and team." 

LCCA and CEO will ensure staff completes intake process till child is admitted into hospital per operation Policy.

The CEO, LCCA and Treatment Director will work together to ensure that staff taking child to hospital will sign child in when bed is available and not leave hospital till child has been fully admitted. Staff will notify LCCA and CEO upon completion of child admitted.

Ms. Kimberly Bass is no longer employed at the operation reducing risk to children.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care was not administered a suicide risk screening after initial screening.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following compliance response on 12/03/2024:

Case Manager will complete assessment according to Unique Teen Policy.

The CEO, LCCA and Treatment Director will review the completed assessment to ensure completion and necessary protective measures are implemented.

Deficiency Narrative:
Based on the documents/credentials provided for verification, the treatment director doesn't meet the 
requirements for emotional disorders.
Correction Narrative: Treatment director was determined to be qualified during third initial inspection based on the updated credentials for the treatment director, and it was verified that the operation is outsourcing services for the children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee's file indicates that references were not contacted.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following compliance plan:
When screening a potential employee, the CEO or the Administrator will use the Texas Health and Human Services Pre-Employment Screening template and contact each employer with the method of contact and the number of attempts for each employer listed.  The operation must contact each employee's three most recent employers if the applicant has had more than 3 employers in the past 5 years. Five-year employment history will also be added to the Unique Teen Employment application.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee application did not have the applicant's employment history.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following compliance plan:
When screening a potential employee, the CEO or the Administrator will use the Texas Health and Human Services Pre-Employment Screening template and contact two references to verify if the potential applicant is suitable to work with and around children.  Method of contact and attempts to contact references will be documented in Pre-employment Screening Template.

Deficiency Narrative: Backseat passenger seatbelt cannot be fastened/secured.
Correction Narrative: Inspector received email with photograph of recipet from repair shop for seat belt repair dated for 3/7/2024 and picture of seat belt secured properly on this date. Inspector emailed LCCA to remind of compliance plan needed for submission.
